alert.note: Alert for Callahan; Shackelford (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 21 at 2:32PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Callahan and southwestern Shackelford Counties through 315 PM CDT... At 232 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Rowden, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Clyde, Baird, Putnam, Rowden, Eula, Admiral and Us- 283 Near The Callahan-Shackelford County Line. This includes Interstate 20 between Mile Markers 294 and 320. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM CDT for west central Texas.
